remarks: The opposite functor of a full functor is also full.  Proposition 3.43(d) in [Adamek] p. 39.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Jan-2017.)
statement:
fulloppc.o $e |- O = ( oppCat ` C ) $.
fulloppc.p $e |- P = ( oppCat ` D ) $.
fulloppc.f $e |- ( ph -> F ( C Full D ) G ) $.
fulloppc $p |- ( ph -> F ( O Full P ) tpos G ) $.
